posts.post_content: If you're focused on pure milling, there are much better alternatives... on the other hand, the lifegain can be benefiting in some situations. Lifegain is not so sucky as all think, it can easily buy you some time to win a game... This is late game card, and it have it's use...

posts.post_content: A combo card more than a mill card. In a straight mill deck, you'll have better options. In a combo deck making infinite mana, this can be the wincon.

posts.post_content:
Gives your Mill deck more staying power, the mana cost and life gain are meant for late game play.  
For example: 6 lands for 4 mill and 4 life. Bringing the opponent closer to death and you closer to life.  
But too expensive for a 5 star rating.

posts.post_content: I like the design of this card, in that it's a [Drain Life](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Drain Life) that hits your library. Seems like a one shot mill effect has to do more than this to be worth playing, though. Maybe if it milled for two times X, but even then, how much mana are you going to have to spend to make this better than [Traumatize](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Traumatize)?
posts.html:
